intro: Xanthochymus quadrifarius, commonly known as the four-leafed chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant color and unique foliage. Xanthochymus quadrifarius is also noted for its resilience to drought and coastal conditions.
